title: Searching for Optimal Runtime Assurance via Reachability and Reinforcement Learning. (arXiv:2310.04288v1 [eess.SY])
abstract: A runtime assurance system (RTA) for a given plant enables the exercise of an untrusted or experimental controller while assuring safety with a backup (or safety) controller. The relevant computational design problem is to create a logic that assures safety by switching to the safety controller as needed, while maximizing some performance criteria, such as the utilization of the untrusted controller. Existing RTA design strategies are well-known to be overly conservative and, in principle, can lead to safety violations. In this paper, we formulate the optimal RTA design problem and present a new approach for solving it. Our approach relies on reward shaping and reinforcement learning. It can guarantee safety and leverage machine learning technologies for scalability. We have implemented this algorithm and present experimental results comparing our approach with state-of-the-art reachability and simulation-based RTA approaches in a number of scenarios using aircraft models in 3D space w

translated_title: 利用可达性和强化学习寻找最佳运行时保证
translated_abstract: 对于给定的系统，运行时保证系统（RTA）允许使用不可信或实验性的控制器，同时通过备份（或安全）控制器来确保安全。相关的计算设计问题是通过根据需要切换到安全控制器来确保安全，同时最大化一些性能指标（例如不可信控制器的利用率）的逻辑。现有的RTA设计策略被广泛认为过于保守，原则上可能导致安全违规。在本文中，我们将最佳RTA设计问题进行了建模，并提出了一种新的解决方法。我们的方法依赖于奖励塑形和强化学习，可以保证安全，并利用机器学习技术实现可扩展性。我们已经实现了这个算法，并在一些使用3D空间飞机模型的场景中，通过实验结果将我们的方法与最先进的可达性和基于模拟的RTA方法进行了对比。
tldr: 本文针对运行时保证系统（RTA）设计问题提出了一种新的方法，利用奖励塑形和强化学习来保证安全并实现可扩展性。
